cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northeast just offshore of the Southeast U.S. coast today, then turning northeast and accelerating parallel to the North Carolina coast and out into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cape Lookout/Cape Hatteras, North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard MA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Savannah River GA to NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Tropical-Storm Warning: NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and lower Chesapeake Bay; Storm-Surge Warning: Savannah River to Poquoson VA including Neuse & Pamlico Rivers and Hampton Roads
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. shoreline from coastal Georgia northward through the Carolinas and into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) possible this morning as Dorian passes well offshore to the northeast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of roughly 1–2 ft above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Expected totals 1–2 inches; locally higher amounts possible in squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents affecting approaches and pilot boarding areas.
